intro: Eriophyton afghanicum, commonly known as the Afghan stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink, often during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
